title: CONTAINERYARD / RICH GUY CONTAINER DOOR
description: Here be the container door with which you converse good Sir, getting rhetorical awards you the ability to *drum-roll* enter the container!

dialogueTree.title: Cargo Container Door: "The door seems to be locked. Conclu..."
dialogueTree.english: The door seems to be locked. Conclusively.
dialogueTree.polish: Drzwi wyglądają na zamknięte. Bez dwóch zdań.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Дзверы выглядаюць зачыненымі. Без двух меркаванняў.

dialogueTree.title: Cargo Container Door: "You're back before the cargo contai..."
dialogueTree.english: You're back before the cargo container. Its draw has not lessened since you were last here. If anything, it seems to have grown slightly.
dialogueTree.polish: Wróciłeś przed kontener transportowy. Jego powab nie zmniejszył się ani o jotę, od kiedy byłeś tu ostatni raz. Co więcej, chyba nawet nieco się zwiększył.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Вы вярнуліся перад транспартным кантэйнерам. Яго прывабнасць не паменшылася ані на кроплю з таго часу, як вы былі тут апошні раз. Больш за тое, здаецца, яна нават крыху павялічылася.

links.title: You: "Knock on the door."
links.english: Knock on the door.
links.polish: Zapukaj do drzwi.
links.belarusian: Пастукай у дзверы.

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "No reply."
links.english: No reply.
links.polish: Żadnej odpowiedzi.
links.belarusian: Ніякага адказу.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "The knock produces a hollow ring of..."
links.english: The knock produces a hollow ring of metal. Doesn't sound like there's anything inside the container.
links.polish: Kiedy pukasz, metal brzęczy głucho. Nie wydaje się, żeby w kontenerze coś było.
links.belarusian: Калі стукаеш, метал глуха звініць. Не здаецца, каб у кантэйнеры нешта было.

links.title: You: "Open the door."
links.english: Open the door.
links.polish: Otwórz drzwi.
links.belarusian: Адкрый дзверы.

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "You attempt to turn the handle, to..."
links.english: You attempt to turn the handle, to no avail. The doors seem to be mechanically locked.
links.polish: Bezskutecznie próbujesz obrócić klamkę. Drzwi wydają się być mechanicznie zamknięte.
links.belarusian: Бязвынікова спрабуеш павярнуць ручку. Дзверы здаюцца механічна зачыненымі.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "To your left, the lieutenant consid..."
links.english: To your left, the lieutenant considers your actions -- with some puzzlement.
links.polish: Stojący po twojej lewej porucznik przygląda się twoim wyczynom z niejakim zdumieniem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант, які стаіць злева ад цябе, з некаторым здзіўленнем назірае за тваімі подзвігамі.

links.title: You: "Persuade the door to open."
links.english: Persuade the door to open.
links.polish: Przekonaj drzwi, żeby się otworzyły.
links.belarusian: Убядзі дзверы, каб яны адчыніліся.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Step aside, rank and file, Savvy's..."
links.english: Step aside, rank and file, Savvy's at the top of the VIP list here. That's right -- out of the way!
links.polish: Z drogi, tłuszczo, Szmaloir jest na samym szczycie listy VIP-ów. Właśnie tak. Won z drogi!
links.belarusian: З дарогі, тлушчу, Шмалоір знаходзіцца на самым версе спісу VIP. Вось так. Прэч з дарогі!

links.title: Rhetoric: "Whoa! Watch it!"
links.english: Whoa! Watch it!
links.polish: Ejże! Uważaj!
links.belarusian: Гэй! Асцярожна!

links.title: Physical Instrument: "How'd he get in front? Little slime..."
links.english: How'd he get in front? Little slimeball...
links.polish: A ten jak się przepchnął na przód? Mały, oślizgły...
links.belarusian: А гэты як прасунуўся наперад? Маленькі, слізкі...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Thank you, thank you. Now, are you..."
links.english: Thank you, thank you. Now, are you ready? It's time to *make our entrance*.
links.polish: Dziękuję, dziękuję. To co, gotowy? Czas *wkroczyć do środka*.
links.belarusian: Дзякуй, дзякуй. Ну што ж, гатовы? Час *уступіць унутр*.

links.title: You: ""Khm-khm..." (Clear your throat, kn..."
links.english: "Khm-khm..." (Clear your throat, knock on the door.) "Hi, it's Savvy here, Savvy with two v's, I'm on the list. The guest list."
links.polish: „Khm, khm...” (Odchrząknij i zapukaj w kontener). „Dzień dobry, tu Szmaloir, czytane »szmalła«. Jestem na liście. Liście gości”.
links.belarusian: «Кхм, кхм...» (Адкашляйцеся і пастукайце па кантэйнеры). «Добры дзень, тут Шмалоір, чытаецца "шмальла". Я ў спісе. Спісе гасцей».

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "At first your knock rings hollow on..."
links.english: At first your knock rings hollow on the door -- and then...
links.polish: Z początku twoje postukiwanie w drzwi rozbrzmiewa tylko głucho. A potem...
links.belarusian: Спачатку тваё стуканне ў дзверы гучыць толькі глуха. А потым...

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "Just like that, you hear a click. T..."
links.english: Just like that, you hear a click. Then a rattle. Some mechanism unlocks itself inside the door.
links.polish: Ot tak – słyszysz kliknięcie, a później grzechot. Jakiś mechanizm odblokowuje się w drzwiach.
links.belarusian: Вось так – чуваць клёканне, а потым грукат. Нейкі механізм разблакуецца ў дзвярах.

links.title: Mega Rich Light-Bending Guy: "From deep within the container, a v..."
links.english: From deep within the container, a voice: "Ahoy! Come on in!"
links.polish: Z głębi kontenera dobiega głos: „Ahoj! Zapraszam!”
links.belarusian: "З глыбіні кантэйнера чуецца голас: «Ахой! Запрашаю!»"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The smile disappears. "You can't be..."
links.english: The smile disappears. "You can't be serious."
links.polish: Uśmiech znika. „To chyba jakiś żart”.
links.belarusian: Усмешка знікае. «Гэта, напэўна, нейкі жарт».

links.title: Rhetoric: "Despite the dirt that surrounds and..."
links.english: Despite the dirt that surrounds and trails you, a beacon of light emerges from deep within you.
links.polish: Mimo brudu, jaki cię otacza i za tobą podąża, z twojego wnętrza wytryska struga światła.
links.belarusian: Нягледзячы на бруд, які цябе акружае і за табой ішоў, з твайго нутра вырываецца струмень святла.

links.title: You: ""Hello, is there anybody in there?""
links.english: "Hello, is there anybody in there?"
links.polish: „Halo? Jest ktoś w środku?”
links.belarusian: «Прывітанне? Хтосьці ёсць унутры?»

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "The door stands silent."
links.english: The door stands silent.
links.polish: Drzwi milczą.
links.belarusian: Дзверы маўчаць.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Satisfied, detective?" A wry smile..."
links.english: "Satisfied, detective?" A wry smile crosses the lieutenant's face.
links.polish: „Zadowolony, detektywie?” – na twarzy porucznika pojawia się krzywy uśmiech.
links.belarusian: «Задаволены, дэтэктыве?» — на твары лейтэнанта з'яўляецца крывая ўсмешка.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Try again."
links.english: Try again.
links.polish: Spróbuj jeszcze raz.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуй яшчэ раз.

links.title: You: ""If there's someone in there, I'd l..."
links.english: "If there's someone in there, I'd like to talk to you."
links.polish: „Jeśli ktoś jest w środku, to chciałbym porozmawiać”.
links.belarusian: «Калі хто-небудзь у сярэдзіне, я хацеў бы пагаварыць».

links.title: Rhetoric: "Aaaaand as it's always been -- it's..."
links.english: Aaaaand as it's always been -- it's impossible to open a container with rhetoric. Maybe you're losing your mind?
links.polish: Iiiii jak to zawsze bywało, nie da się otworzyć kontenera retoryką. Czyżbyś tracił rozum?
links.belarusian: І як заўсёды бывала, нельга адкрыць кантэйнер рыторыкай. Няўжо ты губляеш розум?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Seems like it. You're still hanging..."
links.english: Seems like it. You're still hanging with this fool? Something isn't right...
links.polish: Na to wygląda. Wciąż się zadajesz z tym wcieleniem głupoty? Coś jest nie tak...
links.belarusian: Так выглядае. Ты ўсё яшчэ маеш справы з гэтым увасабленнем дурноты? Нешта не так...

links.title: Rhetoric: "Why are you even trying to open a d..."
links.english: Why are you even trying to open a door with rhetoric?
links.polish: Dlaczego w ogóle próbujesz otworzyć drzwi za pomocą retoryki?
links.belarusian: Чаму ўвогуле спрабуеш адчыніць дзверы з дапамогай рыторыкі?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "That's a very good question conside..."
links.english: That's a very good question considering you have Savvy around -- the ultimate VIP.
links.polish: To bardzo dobre pytanie, biorąc pod uwagę, że jest z tobą Szmaloir. VIP nad VIP-y.
links.belarusian: Гэта вельмі добрае пытанне, улічваючы, што з табой Шмалойр. VIP над VIP-амі.

links.title: You: ""Because getting physical wasn't an..."
links.english: "Because getting physical wasn't an option!"
links.polish: „Bo użycie siły fizycznej nie było opcją!”
links.belarusian: «Бо выкарыстанне фізічнай сілы не было варыянтам!»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because what wasn't an option?" Th..."
links.english: "Because what wasn't an option?" The lieutenant looks startled.
links.polish: „Bo co nie było opcją?” – porucznik sprawia wrażenie zaalarmowanego.
links.belarusian: «Бо што не было варыянтам?» — лейтэнант выглядае занепакоеным.

links.title: You: ""Using my body over my wits.""
links.english: "Using my body over my wits."
links.polish: „Użycie mojego ciała zamiast uroku”.
links.belarusian: „Выкарыстанне майго цела замест абаяння”.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now is not the time to get philoso..."
links.english: "Now is not the time to get philosophical, detective. You can do that after hours."
links.polish: „To nie jest pora na filozofowanie, detektywie. Możesz zajmować się tym po godzinach”.
links.belarusian: «Гэта не час займацца філасофіяй, дэтэктыў. Можаш гэтым займацца пасля працы».

links.title: You: ""Never mind.""
links.english: "Never mind."
links.polish: „Nieważne”.
links.belarusian: «Неважна».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods. "Are you satis..."
links.english: The lieutenant nods. "Are you satisfied, detective?"
links.polish: Porucznik kiwa głową. „Zadowolony, detektywie?”
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант ківае галавой. „Задаволены, дэтэктыве?”

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Have I been summoned?"
links.english: Have I been summoned?
links.polish: Ktoś mnie wzywał?
links.belarusian: Хтось мяне клікаў?

links.title: Rhetoric: "No one needs you. Go away."
links.english: No one needs you. Go away.
links.polish: Nikt cię nie potrzebuje. Idź stąd.
links.belarusian: Ніхто цябе не патрабуе. Ідзі адсюль.

links.title: Rhetoric: "You've got to dance with the one th..."
links.english: You've got to dance with the one that brought you, detective.
links.polish: Musisz puścić się w tan z tym, co cię tu sprowadziło, detektywie.
links.belarusian: Ты павінен аддацца танцу з тым, што цябе сюды прывяло, дэтэктыў.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, why *am* I?""
links.english: "Yeah, why *am* I?"
links.polish: „No właśnie, *dlaczego*?”
links.belarusian: «Вось менавіта, *чаму*?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why are you what?" The lieutenant..."
links.english: "Why are you what?" The lieutenant looks startled.
links.polish: „Co dlaczego?” – porucznik sprawia wrażenie zaalarmowanego.
links.belarusian: «Чаму чаму?» — лейтэнант выглядае ўсхваляваным.

links.title: You: ""Anything at all.""
links.english: "Anything at all."
links.polish: „Cokolwiek”.
links.belarusian: "Што заўгодна".

links.title: Rhetoric: "Who understands anything you do?"
links.english: Who understands anything you do?
links.polish: Kto rozumie cokolwiek z tego, co robisz?
links.belarusian: Хто разумее што-небудзь з таго, што ты робіш?

links.title: You: "Nothing more to do here for now. [L..."
links.english: Nothing more to do here for now. [Leave.]
links.polish: Na razie nie ma tu nic więcej do roboty. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: Зараз тут няма нічога больш рабіць. [Адыдзі].

links.title: You: ""Hey there, sugar.""
links.english: "Hey there, sugar."
links.polish: „Cześć, słoneczko”.
links.belarusian: "Прывітанне, сонейка".

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "The container door appears unmoved..."
links.english: The container door appears unmoved by your attempt at flattery.
links.polish: Drzwi kontenera wydają się niewzruszone twoimi przymilnymi słówkami.
links.belarusian: Дзверы кантэйнера, здаецца, не зважаюць на твае лёсныя словы.

links.title: Suggestion: "A tough nut to crack, for sure. But..."
links.english: A tough nut to crack, for sure. But the strongest containers often have the softest hearts.
links.polish: Ewidentnie twardy orzech do zgryzienia. Ale najtwardsze kontenery często mają najmiększe serca.
links.belarusian: Відавочна цяжкі арэх для разгрызання. Але самыя цвёрдыя кантэйнеры часта маюць самыя мяккія сэрцы.

links.title: You: ""You're a fine piece of engineering..."
links.english: "You're a fine piece of engineering, do you know that?"
links.polish: „Wspaniały z ciebie okaz sztuki inżynierskiej, wiesz?”
links.belarusian: «Выдатны ўзор інжынернага мастацтва, ведаеш?»

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "The door does not respond to your a..."
links.english: The door does not respond to your advances. Is it possible that it seems somehow *more* closed than before?
links.polish: Drzwi nie reagują na twoje słowa. Czy to możliwe, żeby wydawały się jeszcze bardziej *zamknięte* niż wcześniej?
links.belarusian: Дзверы не рэагуюць на твае словы. Ці магчыма, каб яны здаваліся яшчэ больш *зачыненымі*, чым раней?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Why does this situation feel so fam..."
links.english: Why does this situation feel so familiar? Do you have a history of propositioning inanimate objects?
links.polish: Czemu ta sytuacja wydaje Ci się taka znajoma? Masz jakiś nawyk komplementowania przedmiotów nieożywionych?
links.belarusian: Чаму гэтая сітуацыя здаецца табе такой знаёмай? У цябе ёсць звычка кампліментаваць нежывыя прадметы?

links.title: You: ""C'mon, don't shut me out. Let me i..."
links.english: "C'mon, don't shut me out. Let me in."
links.polish: „No już, nie zamykaj się przede mną. Wpuść mnie”.
links.belarusian: «Ну ўжо, не зачыняйся перада мной. Пусці мяне».

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "The door does not respond to your a..."
links.english: The door does not respond to your advances. Is it possible that it seems somehow *more* closed than before?
links.polish: Drzwi nie reagują na twoje słowa. Czy to możliwe, żeby wydawały się jeszcze bardziej *zamknięte* niż wcześniej?
links.belarusian: Дзверы не рэагуюць на твае словы. Ці магчыма, што яны здаюцца яшчэ больш *зачыненымі*, чым раней?

links.title: You: ""It's just another day, another cop..."
links.english: "It's just another day, another cop and another container."
links.polish: „Kolejny dzień, kolejny gliniarz, kolejny kontener”.
links.belarusian: «Яшчэ адзін дзень, яшчэ адзін паліцэйскі, яшчэ адзін кантэйнер».

links.title: Cargo Container Door: "The mundaneness of the situation do..."
links.english: The mundaneness of the situation does not seem to affect the container in the slightest.
links.polish: Prozaiczność sytuacji nie wydaje się jakkolwiek wpływać na kontener.
links.belarusian: Празычнасць сітуацыі, здаецца, ніяк не ўплывае на кантэйнер.

links.title: You: "[Leave the container alone.]"
links.english: [Leave the container alone.]
links.polish: [Zostaw kontener w spokoju].
links.belarusian: [Пакінь кантэйнер у спакоі].

dialogueTree.title: Cargo Container Door: "Before you stands a cargo container..."
dialogueTree.english: Before you stands a cargo container. Just one of many in the yard.
dialogueTree.polish: Przed tobą stoi kontener transportowy. Jeden z wielu na tym placu.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Перад табой стаіць транспартны кантэйнер. Адзін з многіх на гэтай пляцоўцы.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, I think there's someth..."
links.english: "Lieutenant, I think there's something *special* about this container..."
links.polish: „Poruczniku, ten kontener wydaje się być dziwnie *wyjątkowy*...”
links.belarusian: «Лейтэнант, гэты кантэйнер здаецца дзіўна *ўнікальным*...»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs. "Is this like..."
links.english: The lieutenant sighs. "Is this like your thing with that wall again?"
links.polish: Porucznik wzdycha. „To tak jak wtedy z tą ścianą?”
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант уздыхае. «Гэта як тады з той сцяной?»

links.title: You: ""No, it's totally different. I don'..."
links.english: "No, it's totally different. I don't want to paint it. I'm just *drawn* to it."
links.polish: „Nie, to zupełnie inna sprawa. Nie chcę go malować. Po prostu mnie *przyciąga*”.
links.belarusian: «Не, гэта зусім іншая справа. Я не хачу яго маляваць. Ён мяне проста *прыцягвае*».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There are a million containers her..."
links.english: "There are a million containers here. Why are you fixating on this one?"
links.polish: „Stoi tu z milion kontenerów. Dlaczego uparłeś się tak na ten jeden?”
links.belarusian: «Тут стаіць мільён кантэйнераў. Чаму ты так зацяўся на гэты адзін?»

links.title: You: ""Mark my words -- there's someone r..."
links.english: "Mark my words -- there's someone rich buzzing away inside!"
links.polish: „Mówię ci – w środku jest ktoś bogaty. Pobzykuje sobie!”
links.belarusian: «Я кажу табе — унутры нехта багаты. Пабуджае сабе!»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't hear anything." The lieute..."
links.english: "I don't hear anything." The lieutenant cups one of his ears.
links.polish: „Niczego nie słyszę” – stwierdza porucznik, przykładając dłonie do uszu.
links.belarusian: «Нічога не чую», — адзначае лейтэнант, прыкладаючы рукі да вушэй.

links.title: You: ""That's because you're not *tuned i..."
links.english: "That's because you're not *tuned in*. Perks of being a hustler. You'll see -- I'll be rolling in money soon."
links.polish: „Bo nie jesteś *dostrojony*. Takie są korzyści z bycia cwaniakiem. Zobaczysz – niedługo będę tarzał się w forsie”.
links.belarusian: «Бо ты не *наладажаны*. Вось якія перавагі ад таго, што ты хітрык. Убачыш – хутка буду купацца ў грошах».

links.title: You: ""It was hanging from the crane.""
links.english: "It was hanging from the crane."
links.polish: „Bo zwisał z żurawia”.
links.belarusian: «Бо звісаў з жураўля».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You just picked one out, because y..."
links.english: "You just picked one out, because you wanted to interact with a cargo container."
links.polish: „Wybrałeś sobie jeden, bo chciałeś wejść w interakcję z kontenerem”.
links.belarusian: «Вы выбралі адзін, бо хацелі ўзаемадзейнічаць з кантэйнерам».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not here to interact with co..."
links.english: "We're not here to interact with containers -- we're here to get the body down from the tree."
links.polish: „Nie przyszliśmy tutaj, aby wchodzić w interakcję z kontenerami – jesteśmy tu, aby zdjąć zwłoki z drzewa”.
links.belarusian: «Мы не прыйшлі сюды, каб узаемадзейнічаць з кантэйнерамі — мы тут, каб зняць труп з дрэва».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not here to interact with co..."
links.english: "We're not here to interact with containers -- we're here to interview the Union boss."
links.polish: „Nie przyszliśmy tutaj, aby wchodzić w interakcję z kontenerami – jesteśmy tu, aby porozmawiać z szefem Związku”.
links.belarusian: «Мы не прыйшлі сюды, каб узаемадзейнічаць з кантэйнерамі – мы тут, каб пагаварыць з начальнікам Саюза».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not here to interact with co..."
links.english: "We're not here to interact with containers -- we're here to talk to the Union, right?"
links.polish: „Nie przyszliśmy tutaj, aby wchodzić w interakcję z kontenerami – jesteśmy tu, aby porozmawiać ze Związkiem, tak?”
links.belarusian: «Мы сюды прыйшлі не для таго, каб узаемадзейнічаць з кантэйнерамі — мы тут, каб пагаварыць са Саюзам, так?»

links.title: You: ""I don't know, Kim, it just *feels*..."
links.english: "I don't know, Kim, it just *feels* special."
links.polish: „No nie wiem, Kim. *Wydaje się* wyjątkowy”.
links.belarusian: «Ну, не ведаю, Кім. *Здаецца* выключным».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a cargo container, detective...."
links.english: "It's a cargo container, detective. Just like all the others." He doesn't even look at it.
links.polish: „To kontener towarowy, detektywie. Taki sam jak pozostałe” – porucznik nawet nie patrzy w jego stronę.
links.belarusian: «Гэта грузавы кантэйнер, дэтэктыў. Такі ж, як і астатнія», — прапаршчык нават не глядзіць у яго бок.

links.title: You: "(Inspect the container.) "Maybe the..."
links.english: (Inspect the container.) "Maybe there's contraband in there?"
links.polish: (Przyjrzyj się kontenerowi). „Może w środku jest kontrabanda?”
links.belarusian: (Паглядзі на кантэйнер). «Можа, унутры кантрабанда?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant considers this for a..."
links.english: The lieutenant considers this for a moment. "There may very well be, but we're not here to look for that."
links.polish: Porucznik rozważa przez chwilę twoje słowa. „Nie wykluczone, ale nie po to tutaj jesteśmy”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант разважае на імгненне над тваімі словамі. „Магчыма, але не дзеля гэтага мы тут”.

links.title: You: ""You're right, it's probably nothin..."
links.english: "You're right, it's probably nothing."
links.polish: „Masz rację, to pewnie nic takiego”.
links.belarusian: «Ты маеш рацыю, гэта, напэўна, нічога асаблівага».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Damn it, now you've got *me* curio..."
links.english: "Damn it, now you've got *me* curious... this is *not* what we came to the harbour for."
links.polish: „A niech to, teraz *mnie* zżera ciekawość... *Nie* po to przyszliśmy do portu”.
links.belarusian: «А хай яно, цяпер *мяне* грызе цікавасць... *Не* дзеля гэтага мы прыйшлі ў порт».

links.title: You: ""Maybe? I can't tell. I think we sh..."
links.english: "Maybe? I can't tell. I think we should investigate further."
links.polish: „Może tak? Nie wiem. Chyba powinniśmy to dokładniej sprawdzić”.
links.belarusian: «Можа так? Не ведаю. Мабыць, мы павінны гэта больш дакладна праверыць».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do? Because I don't.""
links.english: "You do? Because I don't."
links.polish: „Poważnie? Bo ja nie”.
links.belarusian: «Сур'ёзна? Бо я не».

links.title: You: ""What, why not?""
links.english: "What, why not?"
links.polish: „Co? Czemu nie?”
links.belarusian: «Што? Чаму не?»
